findings.title: DFEF - Duplicate Fee Exempt Functionality
findings.description: The contract utilized two identical functions. The functions `shouldTakeFee` and `shouldTakeFeer` return the same result.

findings.title: RLM - Redundant Liquidity Mechanism
findings.description: The contract implements a liquidity functionality. The variables `liquiditySellFee` and `liquidityBuyFee` are initialized to zero and cannot be modified. Hence, the code segment below will never be executed. As a result, the liquidity functionality and by extension the variables `liquiditySellFee` and `liquidityBuyFee` are redundant.

findings.title: RC - Redundant Calculation
findings.description: The contract performs multiplication and then division with the same value, making the calculation redundant.

findings.title: RMM - Redundant MultipliedFee Mechanism
findings.description: The contract implements a MultipliedFee functionality. The `getMultipliedFee` method always returns the same variable since the multiplier `10000` is equal to the `sellFeeDenominator` variable.

findings.title: TMO - Tax Mechanism Optimization
findings.description: Code segments can be optimized by merging buy and sell taxes as they are immutable and have the same values, resulting in smaller size and less memory consumption.

findings.title: PTRP - Potential Transfer Revert Propagation
findings.description: The contract sends funds to a `marketingFeeReceiver` and `projectFeeReceiver` as part of the transfer flow. This address can either be a wallet address or a contract. If the address belongs to a contract then it may revert from incoming payment. As a result, the error will propagate to the token’s contract and revert the transfer.

findings.title: DDP - Decimal Division Precision
findings.description: Division of decimal (fixed point) numbers can result in rounding errors due to the way that division is implemented in Solidity, leading to issues with precise calculations with decimal numbers.

findings.title: RLF - Redundant Launched Functionality
findings.description: The contract implements a launched functionality where the variable `launchedAt` is initialized to the deployed `block.number`. Hence, the launched method will always return true, making the launched functionality and by extension the variables `launchedAt` redundant.

findings.title: RSW - Redundant Storage Writes
findings.description: The contract updates variables even if its current state is the same as the one passed as an argument, resulting in redundant storage writes.

findings.title: RV - Redundant Variables
findings.description: The variables `liquidityTransferFee`, `marketingTransferFee`, and `projectTransferFee` are not utilized in the contract implementation and hence are redundant.

findings.title: MSE - Missing Solidity Events
findings.description: The contract performs actions and state mutations from external methods that do not result in the emission of events.

findings.title: MSC - Missing Sanity Check
findings.description: The contract is processing variables that have not been properly sanitized and checked that they form the proper shape.

findings.title: PVC - Price Volatility Concern
findings.description: The contract accumulates tokens from taxes to swap them for ETH and triggers the swap functionality when the `swapThreshold` is reached. However, the price of the token can be highly volatile, leading to significant price volatility for the parties involved.

findings.title: RTT - Redundant Transfer Tax
findings.description: The contract implements a transfer tax functionality. The variable `totalTransferFee` is initialized to zero and cannot be modified. Hence, the code segment will never execute with zero `feeAmount` every time. As a result, transfer tax functionality and by extension the variables totalTransferFee and TransferFeeDenominator are redundant.

findings.title: RBF - Redundant Burn Functionality
findings.description: The contract implements a burn functionality. The variables `sellfeeburn` and `buyfeeburn` are initialized to zero and cannot be modified. Hence, the code segment below will execute with zero `amounttoburn` every time. As a result, the burn functionality and by extension the variables `sellfeeburn` and `buyfeeburn` are redundant.

findings.title: RCO - Redundant Conditional Operations
findings.description: The contract performs an if conditional without undertaking any operations when the if statement is fulfilled and also performs conditional operations that are always true due to immutable variables `reflectionFee`, `marketingFee`, and `projectFee` being set to values greater than zero.

findings.title: RDM - Revert Descriptive Message
findings.description: The contract does not provide a descriptive message to the `revert()` function.

findings.title: RSML - Redundant SafeMath Library
findings.description: The usage of the SafeMath library adds complexity, overhead and increases gas consumption unnecessarily since Solidity versions greater than or equal to 0.8.0 provide native functionality for arithmetic operations that revert to underflow and overflow.
